text: this is a brain on nuts nuts have been
getting a lot of attention these days as
a dieters best friend studies have found
that you can snack on modest amounts
without gaining pounds and that nuts can
even help you slim down that seems
totally crazy
since cashews almonds and their legume
Pell the peanut are loaded with fat and
calories even more per ounce than many
popular snacks so I paid a visit to a
nut expert Rick mattis of Purdue
University to find out just what's in
them turns out they're chock full of
protein healthy unsaturated fats fiber
and chew ability which seems to all work
together to cause you to feel full so
you have a better chance of not eating
too many but here's where it gets really
interesting studies are showing that
nuts can cause you to eat less the rest
of the day which makes up for as much as
three-quarters of their calories also as
much as one-fifth of their fat passes
right through your body this is where in
a commercial I'd start talking about
really fast you shouldn't eat more than
a handful of nuts a day or you might
gain pounds no one yet knows if nuts
make you feel full when added to things
like candy bars and it's not yet clear
how many people will find nuts exciting
enough to avoid eating junky snacks that
is how weight loss diets commonly fail
we get bored and abandoned
so Madison's having people snack on nuts
every day for three months and sliding
his subjects into an MRI to see if their
brains get any more or less excited he's
hoping to see people so happy to be
noshing on nuts that the pleasure
centers of their brains keep lighting up
with activity that would mean the lowly
nut just might help us with those heavy
holiday meals
